item.description:
Report X-2024060838

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package came down the QA01 belt. It did not have any other label beside the shipping label. I saw there is a HAZ on the shipping label and a wet spot on one of the side of the box near the bottom. The package is a damaged hazmat that was repacked in a corrugated box with no dot or OP-900 by Nicole M. Adkins (3413529)

item.title: Report I-2024060025
item.description:
Report I-2024060025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: WEST MIFFLIN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No A/C Damage or injuries. Upon unloading the Inbound flight 3909 from BNA. The Ramp agent discovered two bags that were stucldmelted together. Upon peeling the bags apart there was physical damage to both bags. The Hard-shell bag did not have any items impacted on the inside. The softshell bag had an almost completely empty 16oz. bottle of nail polish remover along with a laptop which was still functional and not damaged. Pictures available upon request.

item.title: Report X-2024061069
item.description:
Report X-2024061069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET AND LEAKING UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF SUMA NOVA L6 MECHANICAL DISH DETERGENT THREE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES WERE BENT DENTED CRUSHED WITH A LOOSE CAP CAUSING LEAKAGE AND ALLOWING A TOTAL OF 1 GALLON TO LEAK FROM ALL THREE BOTTLES ALL 4 ONE GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES WERE PACKED UPSIDE DOWN IN THE PACKAGE. NO SLOTTED PARTITIONIS BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024061003
item.description:
Report X-2024061003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: REPORTED TO DR 451. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON CORNER OF THE BOX. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024060291
item.description:
Report X-2024060291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET AND LEAKING UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF TRUE KLEEN FOAM SPRAY ONE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE WAS CRACKED BROKEN ALONG THE SIDE OF THE BOTTLE AND LEAKING ALLOWING 1 GALLON TO RELEASE. PACKAGE DID HAVE ALL BOTTLES IN A PLASTIC BAG ZIPPED TIED CLOSED ALONG WITH SLOTTED PARTITIONS AND A CARDBOARD LAYER ON TOP NO ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION. PACKAGE HANDLER KYRA KEEFER (#5437673) PICKED UP THE PACKAGE OFF THE GRATES TO LOAD IN THE TRAILER NOT KNOWING IT WAS LEAKING, CORROSIVE LIQUID LEAKED ON HER LEG AND GLOVES

item.title: Report E-2024060152
item.description:
Report E-2024060152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: ALLENTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the product that arrived leaking, an unknown amount of MAT50 Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released from two (2) 5-gallon metal cans. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per the SDS. The released product, damaged container, and oil-dri was placed into a 20-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 0.5-gallon of E29C6810+KL5/S Aristocoat Premium Conversion Varnish 10 Sheen released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture by the previous terminal. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the contents into a plastic lined 35-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060100
item.description:
Report E-2024060100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: PUNXSUTAWNEY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUFFALO & PITTSBURGH RAILROAD, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Crew was switching the north bound road train out at Riker yard. The conductor spotted railcar UTLX 211952 was leaking product out of the top of the car. The conductor stopped the move and called BPRR Management. After investigating the manway seal on the top of the rail car it was found to be defective and allowed product to come out. No product was on the ground - only on the side of the car. Crew wiped down side of rail car with absorbent pads and disposed of properly. Notification was made to Rita Mager, Environmental Director. MEI came to Riker yard and made repairs on the car. MEI Report, B&P Spill Report, Photos attached; also available upon request to rita.mager@gwrr.com

item.title: Report E-2024060177
item.description:
Report E-2024060177

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into trailer forklift operator went to go pick up a pallet of pails and while doing so the forkblades on the forklift were to high upon entering the pallet and as a result one of the forkblades struck a pail staged on the pallet consequently puncturing it and contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.
